The normal duty cycle of starter of the engine PW1100G is:
Answers: Three attempts with 35 seconds cooling period between two attempts and total cumulative time is less than 15 min
Three attempts, each attempt last less than 3 minutes with 35 seconds cooling period between two attempts
Three attempts, each attempt last less than 5 minutes with 35 seconds cooling period between two attempts

Questions.QuestionString: The Air Starter is mounted on
Answers: the right side aft of the MGB
the left side aft of the MGB

Questions.QuestionString: The EEC will abort a start, will not dry motor the engine and will not attempt a restart if
Answers: the starter duty cycle is exceeded
EEC unable to control fuel flow

Questions.QuestionString: When an automatic start is manually aborted.
Answers: EEC does dry motor the engine
EEC does not dry motor the engine
EEC does wet motor the engine

Questions.QuestionString: The usual starter duty cycle is 3 starter crank cycles and
Answers: 60 seconds cooling period between each start attempt
35 seconds cooling period between each start attempt
45 seconds cooling period between each start attempt

Questions.QuestionString: “Dual Cooling” mode during engine start:
Answers: Select DUAL COOLING P/B to ON, “COOLING” sequence starts after initiating engine start sequence
Select DUAL COOLING P/B to ON, “COOLING” sequence starts on both engines
